results.title: Baraka [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mark Magidson, Magidson Films and Ron Fricke
results.brief_description: Shot in 24 countries, “Baraka” is an extraordinary visual feast that examines the passionate and destructive love/hate relationship between humans and earth. A spectacular diversity of memorable images have been gathered from around the world from the natural and man-made environments, both past and present. The style is strongly reminiscent of the film “Koyaanisqatsi” in its use of timelapse photography juxtaposed with slower sequences, and the somewhat sentimental, simplistic portrayal of humanity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Magidson, Magidson Films and Ron Fricke

results.title: Bapteme
results.creator_credit: Louis Wipf, Eric Trotta and Rene Feret
results.brief_description:
In 1935, near Bethune (northern France), Aline marries Pierre instead of the man who had been chosen for her. After their honeymoon, Aline replaces her mother running a small cafe while Pierre works on fairs and markets. Largely inspired by the real story of his parents, Rene Feret’s film chronicles the ups and downs of a working class couple from the 1930’s to the 1960’s.

Credits: Producers, Eric Trotta, Louis Wipf ; director, Rene Feret ; writer, Rene Feret ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Frederic Chopin, Evelyne Stroh.
Cast: Valerie Stroh, Jean-Yves Berteloot, Jacques Bonnaffe, Pierre-Alain Chapuis, Edith Scob, Elsa Zylberstein.

results.title: Bantu tribes of Southern Africa
results.creator_credit: Willem Vilioen and Paul Hoefler Special Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the old ways of life among the Zulu, Xhosa, Swazi, Ndebele, Sotho and Venda tribes. These various Bantu groups are now being brought into the South African industrial community. Outlines the ways in which this movement is changing the culture of the tribes and the struggle to preserve some of the old ways.

results.title: Banquet of life
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and James Murray
results.brief_description: Examines the challenge facing man from food shortages and over population in many parts of the world. Questions whether the solution lies in increased food productivity or in control of the birth rate. Much filming was done in Guatemala and Costa Rica.

results.title: Bannerfilm
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Donald Winkler
results.brief_description: Norman Laliberte, one of the most creative designers of banners in North America is shown in his workroom piecing, stitching together, from pieces of varicoloured fabric, figures and symbols reminiscent of ancient pomp and pageantry. Music and movement are used in the film to heighten the effect of the arrangement shaping and growing before your eyes.

results.title: Banksia Serrata
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which looks at a species of native tree, growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. Sound is of a solo flute mixed with native bird calls. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.

results.title: Banksia Integrifolia
results.brief_description: Banksia intergrifolia: a species of native tree growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. Explores the patterns of the characteristic serrated leaves, then buds slowly maturing over many months into nectar-laden flowers. These slowly change to woody “Banksia men” cones. The sound track features a duet of two noisy Friars imitating a pair of Wattle Birds. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.

results.title: Banking in the Next Two Decades
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
An expert in the field discusses the impact of computers on banking in the next two decades, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne (October 16-18,1980)

results.title: Banker's day
results.brief_description: This film looks at how Australian trading banks function, and the services provide for their clients.

results.title: Bank of England
results.creator_credit: John Wiles, Films of Today, Bank of England and John Spencer
results.brief_description: An account of the history and day-to-day functions of the Bank of England and its role in financing Government and industry. Ludovic Kennedy, the presenter, explains the Bank’s role as Government broker and banker, its tasks in issuing Treasury bills, exercising exchange control, keeping the gold reserves, acting as banker to the major clearing banks and printing the country’s supply of banknotes.
